text: we are here in the bullseye of the polar
vortex here in Buffalo New York it is a
negative 12 degrees Celsius you can see
the blizzard like whiteout conditions
I'm actually standing on a frozen lake
erie here's what's happening right now
the polar air is sweeping across this
lake colliding with the warmer
temperatures at its surface and that's
what's creating this snow it's coming
down in about four inches per hour
they're expecting around five feet in
these areas this is why they call it
lake effect snow this area is used to
that amount of snow it is the snow belt
however they're even taking fright at
these temperatures that we haven't seen
in some 20 years roads are closed
schools are closed a state of emergency
is in effect as we drove up here last
night from New York City it looked like
a series of ghost towns and people
hunkered down businesses shut and the
highway littered with overturned cars
Lucy just give us an idea Lindsay if you
are out in it like you are how many
layers you're wearing how people are
coping when they do go outside you need
a lot of layers there's a real science
to it loose-fitting layers you start out
with a layer that's close to your body
long underwear something synthetic a
wicking layer they call it then you need
that insulation layer and then of course
you need this outer layer that protects
you from the wind and the snow keeps you
dry but I have to tell you you still
don't want to be out of this for very
long
